com.verisign.epp.framework
Class EPPResellerHandler

java.lang.Object
  com.verisign.epp.framework.EPPResellerHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
EPPEventHandler
Direct Known Subclasses:
ResellerHandler
public abstract class EPPResellerHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements EPPEventHandler

The EPPResellerHandler class provides an interface for handling EPP Reseller Commands in a Server implementation. EPPEvents are handled by the handleEvent() method here and routed to the appropriate abstract member function. Subclasses should override the abstract methods to define the desired behavior of a particular command when it is received. A subclassed instance of EPPResellerHandler should be registered with the EPPDispatcher so that EEPEvents related to the Registry Mapping will be handled there.

See Also:
EPPEventHandler, EPPEvent

preHandleEvent

protected void preHandleEvent(EPPEvent aEvent,
                              java.lang.Object aData)
                       throws EPPHandleEventException
Handles any common behavior that all registry commands need to execute before they execute their command specific behavior. The default implementation does nothing.

Parameters:
aEvent - The EPPEvent that is being handled
aData - Any data that a Server needs to send to this EPPResellerHandler
Throws:
EPPHandleEventException - Thrown if an error condition occurs. It must contain an EPPEventResponse
